thread.title: Miscues cost Port Isabel in loss
thread.title_full: Miscues cost Port Isabel in loss

author: FREDDY GONZALEZ, Staff Writer
title: Miscues cost Port Isabel in loss
text:
Miscues cost Port Isabel in loss By FREDDY GONZALEZ, Staff Writer Brownsville Herald 
RIO HONDO — Defense took center stage as Port Isabel’s Sea Wall defense allowed 26 yards during the first half and Rio Hondo’s district-leading defense caused four turnovers to give the Bobcats a 20-7 victory Friday night at Bobcat Stadium. 
“When you play P.I., they are going to run down the clock and they are going to pound the ball,” Rio Hondo coach Rocky James said. “(Defensively) we couldn’t get off the field in the first half. In the second, we were able to give the offense more reps and it was hard to get any rhythm. 
“Scoring on the opening drive in the second half really set the tone for us, and I was glad we were able to come out with the victory. We lead the Valley in defense so I knew we were going to come to play, but they drove the ball on us, though, and they did a tremendous job tonight.”
